title: Kristen Stewart said her ex Robert Pattinson is the 'only guy that could play' Batman
text:
Robert Pattinson is the new Batman.

Pattinson will play director Matt Reeves' ("War for the Planet of the Apes") incarnation of the caped crusader in a film slated for release in June 2021.

Naturally, Pattinson's casting caused quite the buzz. While some fans were delighted at the news, others were perplexed, and more were shocked at the former "Twilight" vampire's transition to masked vigilante.

Read more: 10 things you didn't know about Robert Pattinson

Pattinson has some strong supporters, though.

The actor's ex-girlfriend and "Twilight" costar Kristen Stewart had some kind words for him at the Toronto International Film Festival on Saturday.

Stewart told Variety's Marc Malkin that Pattinson was "the only guy that could play that part," and that she was "so happy for him."

"I heard that and I was like, 'Oh man!' It's awesome," she added.

Stewart was in Toronto promoting her new movie "Seberg," in which she plays the eponymous actress and activist Jean Seberg.

Pattinson recently told Variety he was "f---ing furious" when the news of his casting as Batman leaked before he'd even auditioned for the role.

"It was terrifying," he said. "I was like, 'Oh f---! Does that screw me because they are so intent on secrecy?'"

Fortunately, the leak did not screw him, and Pattinson said that wearing the batsuit does make you "feel very powerful immediately."

"The ritual of getting into it is pretty humiliating," he stipulated.

"Once you've got it on, it's like, 'Yeah, I feel strong, I feel tough, even though I had to have someone squeezing my butt cheeks into the legs.'"
